bill.title: State lottery; create and provide for the distribution of revenue from.
bill.description: An Act To Create A State Lottery; To Provide That The State Lottery Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission Regarding The State Lottery; To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Received From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; To Create A Special Fund Into Which A Portion Of The Proceeds Collected From The Sale Of Lottery Tickets Shall Be Deposited And To Provide That Of The Proceeds Of The Lottery That Are Deposited Into The Special Fund The Legislature Shall Appropriate 25% To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Be Used For The Support Of Institutions Of Higher Learning, 25% To The State Board For Community And Junior Colleges To Be Used For The Support Of Public Community And Junior Colleges, 25% To The State Board Of Education For The Support Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety, 10% To The Mississippi Department Of Revenue And 5% To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation The Sale Of Lottery Tickets; And For Related Purposes.
